info.name: Calcarine fissure or sulcus
info.description: The calcarine fissure or sulcus is AKA as Area 17 of Brodmann. It is a prominent sulcus on the medial surface of the occipital lobe consisting of an upper bank (cuneus) and lower bank (lingual gyrus) where the neurons of the primary visual cortex are located.
